text:
Question 83) Born in Lebanon, the two sisters could not be registered in the country, because there is demanded that the born are children of Lebanese fathers and mothers. His parents, of Syrian nationality, could not register them in the country of origin. In Syria, children are only recorded by officially married parents, which was not their case.
In situations such as the one presented in the text, people when they are born are already in the sociopolitical condition of
A) Exhausted.
B) stateless.
C) fugitives.
D) refugees.
E) clandestine.
